intro: Ceropegia albisepta, commonly known as the White-septate Ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and fleshy, succulent stems. The plant produces distinctive, tubular flowers with a white corona and yellow stamens, which are adapted for specific pollination by moths. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to store water. Ceropegia albisepta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
